items.name: Acapella
items.desc:
Acapella
Range: Augment
Style: Double India Pale Ale
ABV: 8.0%
Acapella made a fleeting cameo as part of our output late on last year, the super small batch release only making it out to a super limited number of people before it disappeared back into the wilderness again.
When looking through our brew plans for a beer to rebrew, we decided there was some seriously unfinished business with this beer, and as a result, Acapella is back – absolutely loaded to the nines with the freshest Mosaic, El Dorado, Simcoe and Columbus we could possibly get our hands on; version two is arguably better than our first effort.
Mango, papaya, passionfruit and just a little bit of pithy grapefruit bitterness are all bursting from this amped up, maxed out DIPA.

items.name: Another Shadow
items.desc:
Another Shadow – Berliner Weisse with Kiwi, Lime, Pear and Honey Melon
Range: Augment
Style: Quadruple Fruited Berliner Weisse
ABV: 4.2%
We make no secret of how much our head brewer Lally has expanded our range as a brewery. From his days creating some of the most well regarded classics over at Mad Hatter, we’ve handed the wheel fully over to our resident sour beer chief to create Another Shadow.
A beer with one eye on those amazing triple fruited gose series of beers brewed by our pals up at North, but with a signature Polly’s stamp all over it, we’ve absolutely loaded this beer to the nines with kiwi, lime, pear and honey melon to create a massively fruit-forward Berliner with enough sourness to keep everything in check. Say it with us now! Quadruple! Fruited! Sour!

items.name: DDH Oh My…
items.desc:
DDH Oh My…
Range: Augment
Style: Double India Pale Ale
ABV: 8.5%
The original version of Oh My… turned out to have something in the way of a cult following when we released it back in April. Our collaboration with Chamonix-based Big Mountain Brewing Co utilised everybody’s favourite hype hop Sabro for the first time and set off an obsession which continues to this day, thanks to those super complex coconut, pina colada flavours, paired up with our old faithful Citra for some citrus balance. Fast forward to the present day, with a tonne of both Sabro and Citra in our cold store, and with the blessing of our French pals, we decided to scale up Oh My… with the Polly’s DIPA treatment. An insane dry hop charge of 50kg means those juicy pina colada notes are amplified to the max for a DIPA that drinks well below its ABV.

items.name: Fake Attentions
items.desc:
Fake Attentions
Range: Augment
Style: India Pale Ale
ABV: 6.3%
We needn’t remind you that we love all things old school whilst simultaneously melding new school techniques into the beers we create. When designing the recipe for Fake Attentions, we noticed a pattern in that our use of the old school varietals in the dry hop bill was somewhat reserved, with the new school hype hops taking centre stage, and with that, the majority of the sensory notes. We thought “why not flip this one on its head and let an old school hop take the lead?” and Fake Attentions was born. With 20kg of Amarillo leading things alongside smaller additions of Citra, and even smaller additions of Mosaic and Azacca, this beer bursts with punchy orange, and floral notes, before the juice follows up from our new school favourites. Clean, crisp, hoppy, and downright delicious.

items.name: Like, Forever…
items.desc:
Like, Forever…
Range: Augment
Style: Pale Ale
ABV: 5.2%
Ahh, those super sessionable, mega smashable pale ales we love so much. There’s just something about a 5.2% pale ale that makes it perfect as an after work beer. Maybe it’s our fondness of loading them with both new school and old school hops to give that mega juiciness alongside crisp, clean bitter notes that make them so drinkable; whatever it is, there’s just a little bit of magic that happens with our beers when they hit that 5.2% mark.
Like, Forever – named for a remark made in the brewery during a particularly long double canning day – features a ten minute whirlpool addition of Chinook, before adding more again in the dry hop. Paired up with a Polly’s favourite in Simcoe, this beer bursts with passionfruit, apricot, pine and resinous notes.

items.name: Reality Dysfunction
items.desc:
Reality Dysfunction
Range: Augment
Style: Double Dry-Hopped Pale Ale w/Lactose
ABV: 5.5%
Our staff designed DDH Pale series is certainly gaining some serious traction now, and we’re rolling onto another one in rapid time before we take a short break, with the arrival of Reality Dysfunction – designed entirely by our assistant brewer Matt.
Expressing his love for our lactose-tinged output, Matt brought the mash temperature right down to ensure the beer wasn’t overly sweet, and hit the dry hop up with a bumper dry hop charge of Enigma for a symphony of flavours that dance throughout.
Expect intense amounts of raspberries, passionfruit, and just a smattering of herbal complexity, complimented by the sweetness and full body brought to the table by the lactose addition in the boil. Bravo Matt!

items.name: Simplify The Manifest
items.desc:
Simplify the Manifest
Range: Augment
Style: Pale Ale
ABV: 5.2%
We’ve said it before and we’ll say it again – we love melding elements of those old school beers we grew up loving, with the new school juice craze we’re fully embedded in. It’s a characteristic that has become part and parcel of our beers, and we totally vibe off it. Simplify the Manifest is our latest entry into this hybridized new/old school style, with a hop lineup of Chinook for pithy grapefruit, pine and resin notes playing off a tonne of mango, passionfruit and tangerine notes from new school stalwart, Mosaic. A pale ale perfect for good times, and smashing with pals (in socially distant groups of less than six, please).

items.name: Strip & Drift
items.desc:
Strip & Drift
Range: Augment
Style: West Coast DIPA
ABV: 9.0%
Jim Morrison hit the nail on the head in The End – The West is the best. After successful forays into the style that made us fall in love with beer in the first place with Change, Irreversible and Transit Culture, there was only one logical step to go from there. Go big or go home, and brew up a huge DIPA. A big three-C classic hop combo of Chinook, Citra and Columbus are at play in this loving homage to the OG craft trailblazers of America, without whom we wouldn’t exist today. A DIPA in perfect balance – sweet, biscuity malts initially, before an onslaught of piney, resinous hops, rounding off with a lingering bitter finish. Treat it gently, this one bites!

items.name: The One You Can’t Control
items.desc:
The One You Can’t Control
Range: Augment
Style: DDH India Pale Ale
ABV: 7.2%
Galaxy and Mosaic. The two hop varietals that put us on the map with one of our very first beers, way back in those halcyon Loka Polly days. After seeing an absolute tonne of both in our hop store, the decision was made for us to go back to this holy grail pairing for the brewery. But what to do to differentiate it from that original version? Why not ramp up the hop bill to an insane 50kg, for a hopping rate of 24g/l – in other words, hop an IPA at the same rate as one of our DIPAs? Galaxy is front and centre here, showing just exactly why it’s one of the most sought after varietals in brewing today, with its passionfruit, peach, and pineapple accentuated by our similarly generous use of Mosaic during fermentation.
